Upon reaching the car I then noticed that my car wasn't even locked !!! This is NOT the kind of experience I want to have at 11PM, tired from visiting paris and having two young children with me. The hotel is nice and friendly but the car park is a total rip-off. I would strongely urge the owners of the hotel to have a very long talk with the owners of the car park. The experience I had with the car park is for me enough NOT to return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Gare L'Est”
Reviews.Author: Evergreen05
Reviews.Content: Chosen because of proximity to Gare L'Est and price. Very clean, has lift, no small refrigerator and no airconditioning. Could be rather warm in July/August. The refit has been reasonably recent so it all looks good on the surface. Room adequate but quite small. Breakfast is extra - buy yoghurt & fruit instead. Cheap internet is available in the area, and that is often a guide to the suburb. We only stayed a night en route to the country. Desk staff very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “a great location/great price”
Reviews.Author: SheyBu
Reviews.Content: Hotel Soft was great - it was exactly at the location that served us best., very neighborhood like, but still surrounded by romantic Paris. I wanted to be next to the Canal St. Martin, and it was a perfect two blocks from it. And the 15 min. walk to Gare Nord was also extremely practical, as we were arriving through there. Also, there is a super market down the road (a block away) where one can buy something if missed without having to pay extortion touristy area prices. Plus there are quite a few nice restaurants in the area itself and along the canal itself (try Hotel du Nord, Le Jammape). And its just a walk away from La Republique, then on to le Marais, Pompidou Center and and on and on. The hotel itself was great. The rooms were quite a good size for Paris standards and decorated with bright colours. The bathroom was also a good size, clean and quite modern. The bets thing in there were the pillows! I wanted to steal one :)! The staff were also very friendly and accommodating. I prefer staying in a place where we can feel like we are with a family style accommodation rather than by-the-rules stuffiness. The only thing is that there is no fridge in the room. But otherwise, I would definitely stay there again. Price and location were great for me!

Reviews.Title: “okay for it's price”
Reviews.Author: veussel
Reviews.Content: - location: a few minutes from gare de l'est, good location breakfast: "french": bread, cereales, jam, yoghurt,....simple but okay, staff very friendly room: as expected, good for paris standards bed: i had a good sleep bathroom: not so good. when they renovated it, they forget finish the details: cracks in the floor, brown marking in the shower(damp...) overall, 1 night is sufficient and this is a hotel for business travellers

Reviews.Title: “Great location and staff !!”
Reviews.Author: kiwigirltravelling
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for a weekend family break, within walking distance from Gare du Nord - about 15 mins. Very friendly staff - especially the lovely Ahmed ! Nice street with the canal at the end and a small local supermarket. Bit noisy on one night with a few police sirens but thats Paris I guess - always busy.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money - cool, minimal design and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: cena67
Reviews.Content: Soft Hotel would cost much more in a trendier part of Paris like Marais, making it good value for people less bothered by its slightly sketchy neighbourhood. Rooms are clean, modern, efficient and quite roomy for Paris. Staff are friendly and helpful. There was bit of a noise issue due to building works next door but nothing intolerable. I've stayed at countless Parisian budget hotels over the years, and Soft offers rare combination of cool, clean design (without tacky chintz), decent staff and good prices which are even cheaper via internet. Neighbourhood near Gare de l'Est is charmless and bit rough. but short metro to better areas. Probably best for experienced solo travellers, young couples and budget business travel!

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MinnTex
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with a group and the staff were very accommodating. Location is very convenient and in a decent neighborhood; it is not on a main street, so it is fairly quiet. (Hint: use the Gare de l'Est for your metro location; there is another station that is a 100 meters closer, but you will most likely have to change lines.) The breakfast has a decent variety--not fantastic but the café au lait is endless and the breads are very good.

Reviews.Title: “Superficial decoration”
Reviews.Author: Mansies
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok - the service and location are very good, but the decoration of the rooms is only superficial. The heater was coming off the wall, there were exposed pipes and a hole in the ceiling, cracked tiles in the bathroom and poorly aligned wallpaper. It was fairly quiet, with just a little noise from the street and some doors banging from other guests. I didn't eat the breakfast as there are plenty of local patisseries. The 'air conditioning' is a noisy fan that turns on in the bathroom when the light is turned on. I felt ok about staying here, but as it was my first trip to Paris I don't know how it compares to other hotels. On my next trip to Paris I think I will try elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, cosy, good cost-benefit”
Reviews.Author: dilligevisfac
Reviews.Content: The rooms are really small and the bathroom even smaller. But Soft Hotel is nice, clean, has a very attentive personnel and a decent breakfeast. If you want a hotel only to sleep at night after a busy turist day, Soft Hotel is the right place for you. An important note: rooms don't have frigobars, but they allow you to store one treat or two in the hotel refrigerator.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and clean but not so safe”
Reviews.Author: SarahSmileOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 1 night before leaving Paris. The hotel was clean and updated. You can tell that they tried to make an old hotel modern but did it with the bare minimum. The bathroom had a nice new tub, sink and toilet but they were installed over old, dated, cracked tile. I believe that if you are going to do something, do it right. The bedding was nice but when I pulled back the covers they had an old tattered brown blanket which kind of creeped me out. On the taxi ride to the hotel we were shocked at the kind of people in that area - not safe looking at all. We went out for dinner early because we did not want to walk in that area at night. We were very surprised that when we went out for dinner the area had completely changed, there were far less people on the streets (5 pm). Then we realized that there were police on every corner (no joke) checking everyone's papers. Yikes. We walked 15 mins to the Rue Montorgueil for dinner where we felt comfortable and we knew that there were good restaurants. It was conveniently located 10 mins from the train station which worked for us because we had an early flight but I would not recommend this hotel for people staying in Paris and venturing out at night. Clean, comfortable, affordable and suitable if you are not intimidated by this type of area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, cosy and chic!”
Reviews.Author: nadz4nier
Reviews.Content: Hotel Soft is situated in a quiet, peaceful neighborhood near two major metro stations which makes transportation very efficient. There are cheap and delicious places to eat right around the corner. The hotel room itself is very clean and pretty and looks exactly the way it is presented on the website. The shower is also very strong; we had no problems getting hot water. The free wi-fi in the room is also very convenient and a great plus. The staff is very courteous and friendly and all speak good English. All are informative and helpful concerning tourist matters, like how to get to the major attractions and the best deals for touring. We enjoyed our stay at Le Soft very much and hope to return on our next trip to Paris. Merci messieurs et madame! -Stephanie & Nadine

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: citizenDiego
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 days. The area surrounding the hotel is not what you expect from Paris but this is a problem of the city and not of the hotel itself. Its close to 2 metro stations and you can easily reach any part of Paris. The lobby and rooms were recently renovated. The room and toilet are small but just offers what you need, contemporary and "new" furniture. I think anyone can't complaint about the overall of the hotel. Another plus is the free wi-fi connection, fast enough. Breakfast is expensive but all hotels are the same. It's only lacking on details. 2 lamps in the room were not working and the toilet amenities are under expectation (if they spend money personalizing the remote control with the name of the hotel why dont they offer better selection of shower gel, soup, ...?) I would recommend this hotel and if I go to Paris again I would stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Awesomeness”
Reviews.Author: H38caKg0L
Reviews.Content: The room deco is amazing - i mean, AMAZING!!11!one. Everything about the deco from the lights to the bed to the table and curtains and wallpaper just seemed to meld into one another with a hallowed chorus of "...come stay in meeee!..." I've stayed in 5-star hotels with worse furnishings, and the samsung flat screen TV just makes it so much better (didnt switch it on though). The lounge was still under renovation when i arrived, so hopefully finish that soon with the same vintage theme deco as exists in the rooms. Oh, did i mention that the room looked friggin' awesome? The concierge was friendly too. Only complaint was the unbelievably narrow corridors, and if the chambermaid leaves her trolley around, it blocks the entire corridor (and you've to do handstands and cartwheels and gymnastic doodles to get to your room). The lift is spacious for european standards, and it comes with a mirror for those who'd like to check their hair (ok that's irrelevant) Breakfast was simple but yummy, consisting of the usual croissants/ buns and cereal. Another complaint would be the random pipe running from the ceiling that makes funny trickling noises (would be a simple matter to plaster it off, I don't really care anyway, the deco was way too good). Overall 75 Euro buys you a small pretty room that's completely worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Soft”
Reviews.Author: GGGGGB
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is only a few minutes walk from Gare de L'Est train station. There are some lovely bars and restaurants near the canal. The rooms were brilliantly designed and very comfortable. The reception area is quite small, however, if you do not want to gather in this area you won't mind.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Soft Hotel Paris!!!”
Reviews.Author: jasmine1London
Reviews.Content: Arrived on the 14th of November 2008 (Weekend) with reservation made over the phone, and confirmed instantly by email by very pleasant and friendly Nathalie. Very clean, cosy ensuite roooms, regularly cleaned. Genuinely friendly staff (including the cleaners). Guaranteed noise-free good night sleep. High quality, high standard, friendly staff, 10/10. (Jenny)

Reviews.Title: “simple easy borderline chic paris base”
Reviews.Author: gjs0987
Reviews.Content: We just returned yesterday from our 4 night´s stay at Hotel Soft. This was my first time in Paris and my partner´s third. We are a young couple, 21 and 23, yet have traveled extensively worldwide and tend to prefer chic boutique hotels which are a bit more design conscious. Of course, at our age, that can often be impossible. I spent many hours searching for the perfect hotel because I have heard so many terrible things about Paris hotels. And I think for what I was looking for, this hotel had everything we were looking for. It was a weekend Thursday-Monday stay with a lot packed in and a busy schedule with friends in Paris and we simply couldn´t bear to encounter hotel problems. From the beginning, the hotel staff was extremely kind and helpful. They even made a us a reservation at a restaurant when we asked because our French is not so great. The lobby is not as nice as it is in the photos but in the end, the lobby is useless and serves no purpose after check in. We did not even purchase breakfast there which I think is a waste for 14 euros. There are great places around the corner. Anyways, past the lobby, the hotel itself is small and I love the way it is organized. The hallways are very narrow but long and well divided and everything is carpeted and dimly lit. It has more of an apartment feel or even fashion boarding house feel than a hotel. It´s exactly the ambience we like. We stayed in room 301 which was a cosy room. We had one of the pink rooms like on the website photos. I´m not sure how the other rooms look like, but I think they all come with flat screen tvs. I specifically emailed the hotel and asked for the room in the picture which I usually do to ensure the best. The room was quite large there was space for everything. Our room had a large window to the street which let in some light. During the summer I´m sure it´s wonderful as the window opens up entirely. Also the bathroom was great. Very very large and came with a bath. The sink, everything was very well decorated and it never really felt like a hotel. Everything was just so simple and understated and understandable. The carpet in the room was also very clean and comfortable. I read some other reviews which talked about thin walls. We didn´t hear anything but we also were only in the room at night and to sleep. Each floor only has 6 rooms. 3 on each side. So it makes it quite quiet I guess when people walk by. The lighting also was great in the room. The little complaints I have where the following. There were no drawers and not enough hangers. Silly things but I like to totally unpack my bags. There was a lot of floor space for everything but a little chest would have come in handy. Although the nightstands where great! And the toiletries were very minimal like in every hotel. But we always bring our own anyways so that wasn´t a problem. The location. The thing is we love to walk. And yes the hotel is not smack down in the center near the louvre. But you are 15-20 min walk to the marais which is a very nice walk, and metro is easy to get anywhere else because gare d´est is 2 minutes away. So if you´re worried about the location like I was, don´t be. Overall, great stay and I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Soft is very good”
Reviews.Author: smfBethlehem
Reviews.Content: My colleague and I had a very pleasant week-long stay at the Hotel Soft. The management was very helpful for both business and tourist activities. They had a room available for us we arrived at 9 am from our flight from the U.S. The room, which was the largest they had, had a king bed and a small single in the corner. It was comfortable for two of us, although a little sparse--no drawers to put anything in--just a small closet. The free WiFi connection in the room worked better than that often found in U.S. hotels and was a great bonus for my work. The hotel's location is good since it is very close to Gard de L'Est, which allowed us to use the Metro easily to go to many tourist destinations. This is a fine hotel for its price range.

Reviews.Title: “Good base to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Neil1982
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel to take my girlfriend away for surprise weekend. After reading the reviews I thought it was a safe bet and in my price range. We arrived at the hotel Saturday morning after getting the Eurostar to the Gard Nord, it's about a 20 minute walk from the station however Gard East is the nearest Metro. On arrival at the hotel we were told we couldn't book in until the afternoonm this wasn't a problem as there was a secure room where we could leave our bags. The receptionist was friendly and gave us advice on the local area and the metro. The hotel is about a 10 min metro ride to the centre of Pars on line 4 from the Gard East. Our room was very clean and tidy, not a bad size and had everything we needed. The bathroom was fine with lots of hot water. The only downside was the view from the balcony, which was a brick wall. We were on the 1st floor. We booked a bed and breakfast deal, the breakfast was nice, with a selection of bread, cakes, cereal, yogurts etc. Overall no problems with the hotel and it made for a great weekend. The area around the hotel is fairly nice, with the canel near by and lots of bars / restaurants. Would come here again, but ideally would like a bit more luxury next time, however for the price I couldn't complain.

Reviews.Title: “Cosy, comfortable and convenient”
Reviews.Author: Star102
Reviews.Content: Our room at the Soft hotel was cosy, clean and comfortable. They are in the process of renovating the hotel completely and have clearly made the effort to go beyond the basics to provide nice decor, big comfy beds, thick windows to block out street noise and dark curtains to ensure a good night's sleep. The location is very convenient for arriving into the city at Gare du Nord and very close to the metro to get into the centre easily. Excellent value, I would definitely stay there again if I return to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in the loveliest area in Paris”
Reviews.Author: smeng78
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at Hotel Soft and as usual, it is lovely. The staff are extremely friendly and the rooms are lovely sized for Paris. The room decor and furnishings are nice and simple. This hotel is simply a bargain find in Paris and is certainly value for money. The breakfast is nice and filling. There's a bread basket, yoghurt, cornflakes, tea, coffee and juice. All good enough to start off your day. The area around Canal Saint Martin is really lovely and the road where the hotel is has plenty of nice looking restaurants to eat. Not to mention that the hotel is very close to Gare du Nord and Gare de L'est. If you're looking for a less than usual tourist experience and more Parisien, then this is the area to stay. I do think that given the rate of the rooms, the hotel is certainly deserving of full marks.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, OK location”
Reviews.Author: je55
Reviews.Content: Liked the Hotel Soft - the rooms are reccently renovated, clean and a good size. The reception staff were very friendly and were able to provide maps and good adivce on how to get about. The street where the hotel is is nice enough, but I wasn't that keen on the general area. Arriving back to the hotel after 10pm, the streets didn't feel that safe but saying that, the hotel is close to several metro stations so getting to central paris is quick and easy.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Soft
HotelInfo.Address: 52 bis rue des Vinaigriers, 75010 Paris, France
